snippet: President Mahmoud Abbas of the Palestinian Authority said Israel was withholding authorized weapons, and he expressed worries about a widespread prison hunger strike.
abstract: President Mahmoud Abbas of the Palestinian Authority says that his security forces are struggling because Israel refused to allow them to import a shipment of weapons; also expresses concern about what might happen if one of the Palestinian prisoners on a long-term hunger strike dies.
lead_paragraph: President Mahmoud Abbas of the Palestinian Authority said Israel was withholding authorized weapons, and he expressed worries about a widespread prison hunger strike.

headline.seo: Mahmoud Abbas Says Israel Is Hindering West Bank Security
headline.main: West Bank Leader Says Security Forces Can’t Get Guns
headline.print_headline: West Bank Leader Says Security Forces Can’t Get Guns
